newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Gilts to drift down to support at 108-26.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Gilts to drift down to support at 108-26.

text.p: June gilt futures will struggle to make much headway on Friday and may drift down to support around 108-26, technical analysts said.

"The gilt market has broken below its recent uptrend and that uptrend is now providing some resistance at 110-05," said Chase technical analyst Guenter Redeker. "The market will really have a lot of difficulty getting above that level."
Guenter put initial support at 108-26, then 108-20. If they both cave in, the market will find a key prop at 108-06 he added.
"If the market drops below 108-06, the long term uptrend is broken, suggesting significantly lower prices down to 107-19, the low in January, and beyond," said Redeker.
On the upside, Redeker said gains above initial resistance at 109-15, which also represents down trendline resistance, was needed to relieve the immediate downward pressure on the contract.
"But a daily closing price above 110-05 is needed to open upside potential to 110-29 and once above here it will test 112-09," he said.
By 0824 GMT the June gilt was up 15/32 on the day at 109-13.

Richard Adcock, manager of technical research at HSBC Futures here, said momentum indicators suggested a more prolonged decline in gilts was on the cards, to take the market back to the longer term objective at 108-00.
"Against this background, with strength set to be held up to 109-25, upside offers further selling opportunities ahead of the expected decline," Adcock said in a client note.
By 0828 GMT, June short sterling was up three basis points at 93.34.
Adcock said the contract may consolidate for the time being, but added strength would likely be limited to around 93.43.
RSI - 14 day -- Gilt 29 pct, Short stg 33 pct
